content: 5 sts cut the yarn leaving a tail for sewing up and thread through the remaining five stitches sew the head seam and stuff the head lightly using the cast on ends gather the bottom of the feet and close the leg seams for each leg cut a 10 cm / 4 length of pipe cleaner fold it in half and push the folded half into the leg the other ends will be inside the body now close the back seam adding a little stuffing as you go if you fold the legs into a sitting position while you do this it will stop the stuffing going into them run a gathering thread round the neck to tighten it arms these are worked in the same way as the legs but are slightly longer using the long tail method and 2 mm needles cast on five stitches row 1 purl row 2 k1 *m1 k1 repeat from * to end 9 sts work 11 row in stocking stitch starting with a purl row cast off gather the cast on end and close the seam insert a 5 cm / 2 folded pipe cleaner into each arm and close the top sew the arms to the body sew the inside of the arm a little way down the body so that the arms point downwards rather than out to the sides ears using the long tail method cast on three stitches row 1 purl row 2 k1 m1 k1 twice 5 sts row 3 purl cast off gather the cast off edge and sew to the head with the knit side of the stocking stitch facing forward muzzle using the long tail method cast on six stitches cast off knot the yarn ends together and sew to the front of the head embroider eyes nose and mouth with black 4 ply yarn if you add a few tiny stitches to the centre of the eyes with light coloured sewing thread it will bring them to life © frankie brown 2013 the bed the sheet and blanket are knitted in one piece beginning at the top of the sheet using the cable method and 2 75 mm needles cast on 16 stitches knit 56 row or until the sheet is long enough to fit inside the bottom of the tin about 9 cm / 3½ next row purl next row k2 m1 k4 m1 three times k2 20 sts next row purl next row purl the blanket is worked in a four row slip_stitch pattern with two row in the blanket colour c followed by two in the sheet colour m row 1 c knit row 2 c purl row 3 m *k1 sl 1 pwise wyib repeat from * to end row 4 m knit work these four row eight times or until the blanket measures about 4 5 cm / 1¾ now knit another five row in m for the top of the sheet cast off knitwise sew the two
